pathetic, dead face. 
In a corner of the room something red and tiny gave a grunt and squealed in Mary Bog- ddnovna's trembling white hands. 
Two hours later Prince Andrew, stepping 
softly, went into his father's room. The old man already knew everything. He was stand- ing close to the door and as soon as it opened his rough old arms closed like a vise round his son's neck, and without a word he began to sob like a child. 
Three days later the little princess was buried, and Prince
